Description: One of a pair of gold ear-rings. Hoop of twisted wire terminates in a bull's head; the hollow head is hammered from a sheet of metal and decorated with beaded wire. The other end of the ring tapers to a fine point and attaches to a hoop in the animal's mouth.
Curator's comments: Accompanied by a green oval card inscribed: ‘Pair of/gold earrings with/bulls’ heads./4th cent. B.C./according to Prof. Flinders Petrie./ ‘Egyptian’ according to/Dr. Budge. Very good! ’ (front) ‘Coll. N. M. Richardson./[house name] Montevideo/ near Weymouth/said by Dr. Budge/(British Museum) to be/Egyptian of Ptolemaic/period (cir. 100 B.C.) &/very good. (back) One of two ear-rings acquired at the same time (with EA 82962). Cf., Petrie, Objects of daily use (1927), nos 174-75, pl. VIII; and G&R 1896,0201.270 from Kourion, Cyprus.
